TopicTitle: How many patches does your Module Manager apply?

Articles.Content:
Figured this would be a neat topic to see. So, as the title says, how many patches does module manager apply in your install? Obviously patches don't mean as much, because they're just small config edits, but as the amounts start to grow it almost always indicates a heavy mod presence in any given install.

As you can see below, my current Stockalike focused install applies over 16 thousand patches with a little under 90 different mods installed. 

![444B4E625CE814A4E20C874E628C9FFDC9A6EB34](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/621843625271807761/444B4E625CE814A4E20C874E628C9FFDC9A6EB34/)

Hi

122. Its enough, Stock play is great now.

I use Joint reinforcement, Engineer redux, Raster prop monitor.
Mod-related discussion moved to the mod-related subforums.
Well with all mods I wanted was around 59k

Wasn't there a poll based thread on the same thing? It's a few months old though.

Anyways, I don't remember the exact number, but 8k+ for me.

4k for me

> 
> Well with all mods I wanted was around 59k

![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif) How in the...... How much Ram is being used, and how many mods.
I can't read mine because it layers two lines of text on top of each other. OS X for the win!

> 
> I can't read mine because it layers two lines of text on top of each other. OS X for the win!

Sounds like you have two versions of modulemanager in your GameData.

Also, mine applies 2,716 patches.
